Мнемоника

Земляная 土 могила, где человек превращается в прах 莫.

mù
grave; tomb; mausoleum
могила; гробница; мавзолей
rtega_mnemonic:
墓墓RSgrave, tomb
  • made in clay 土 and not visible under the grass 莫
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 莫 indicates the sound; 土 (earth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
坟墓 [ fén mù ]: grave; tomb
墓地 [ mù dì ]: cemetery; graveyard
墓葬 [ mù zàng ]: (archeology) grave; tomb
公墓 [ gōng mù ]: public cemetery
墓碑 [ mù bēi ]: gravestone; tombstone
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 莫 [ mò ] cannot; do not; is not; negative
    • 土 [ tǔ ] soil, earth; items made of earth
heisig_chinese_memo: The soil under a graveyard is full of graves.
heisig_constituent: grave, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, soil, dirt, ground
heisig_story: The mounds of soil with crude wooden crosses set at their head suggests those boot-hill graves we all know from cowboy lore. The only odd thing about this kanji is that the soil comes UNDER the graveyard, rather than to its left, where we might expect. Just think of the bodies as "lying under boot-hill" if you have any trouble. By the way, this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that we learn a kanji whose key word is the same, or almost the same, as a primitive element based on it, but whose shape differs somewhat. There is no cause to worry. By using the primitive in a variety of other characters, as we have done here, the confusion will be averted as a matter of course. In most cases, as here, the primitive element is taken from a part of the fuller kanji.
koohiiStory1: The soil under a graveyard is full of graves.
koohiiStory2: A grave is a patch of soil in a graveyard.
jp_example_words:
墓地(はかち): cemetery, graveyard
墓(はか): gravesite, tomb
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There's a strange patch of dirt in this greenhouse that's actually a grave. Dig around a little and you'll find the marker buried in there. If you dig deeper you'll probably find less pleasant things.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: I guess it makes sense to have a grave in a greenhouse. The heat will help the body decompose, then that nice, rich dirt will help the flowers grow.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide to dig even deeper into the grave out of curiosity and you find a bow (ぼ) and some arrows. This must be the grave of a great archer! But you probably shouldn't keep digging around in this grave looking for more stuff.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hold the grave bow in your hands. It smells like dirt and wood. Maybe no one will notice if you take it... though you may end up haunted by whoever is buried in this grave.
Ru_Radicals: 土 (земля), 大 (большой), 艾 (мокса), 日 (день)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ground (土) you must not (莫) go near is a grave
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The soil under a graveyard is full of graves.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " earth " to " mo " sound. The original meaning is tomb. "Shuowen": "Tomb, Qiuye. From the soil, no sound." Duan Note: "Qiu is from its high words, the tomb is from its plain words, and the words are the Qiu tomb." " grave ", there is no fief uplift is " grave " and later Jieke indiscriminately referred to as " grave ." Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The 29th Year of Xianggong": "Xia Siyue, the king of Chu Kang was buried, and the burial of the father and Chen Hou, Zheng Bo, and Xu Nan. As far as the west gate, the princes and doctors are all in the tomb." "Han. "The Chu Yuan King's Biography": "Confucius buried his mother in Fang, calling the ancient tomb but not the grave.

" Tomb " also means tomb area, graveyard. Such as "Poetry. Chen Feng. The Tomb Gate: "The tomb gate has thorns, so use the axe to make it." Kong Yingdashu: "The tomb is called the tomb." "Book of Rites. Song Lishang": "If the tomb is suitable for burials, the burial must be carried out." Zheng Xuan's note: "Tombs, tomb areas."
humanum_short_description_en: From " earth " to " mo " sound. The original meaning is tomb.
humanum_full_description:
從「土」，「莫」聲。本義是墳墓。《說文》：「墓，丘也。从土，莫聲。」段注：「丘自其高言，墓自其平言，渾言之則曰丘墓也。」古代稱封土隆起的為「墳」，沒有封土隆起的為「墓」，後來不加區別皆可稱為「墓」。如《左傳．襄公二十九年》：「夏四月，葬楚康王，公及陳侯、鄭伯、許男送葬，至於西門之外，諸侯之大夫皆至于墓。」《漢書．楚元王傳》：「孔子葬母於防，稱古墓而不墳。」

　　「墓」也表示茔域、墳地。如《詩．陳風．墓門》：「墓門有棘，斧以斯之。」孔穎達疏：「塋域謂之墓。」《禮記．曲禮上》：「適墓不登壟，助葬必執紼。」鄭玄注：「墓，塋域。」

從「 土 」，「 莫 」聲。本義是墳墓。《說文》：「墓，丘也。从土，莫聲。」段注：「丘自其高言，墓自其平言，渾言之則曰丘墓也。」古代稱封土隆起的為「 墳 」，沒有封土隆起的為「 墓 」，後來不加區別皆可稱為「 墓 」。如《左傳．襄公二十九年》：「夏四月，葬楚康王，公及陳侯、鄭伯、許男送葬，至於西門之外，諸侯之大夫皆至于墓。」《漢書．楚元王傳》：「孔子葬母於防，稱古墓而不墳。」 「 墓 」也表示茔域、墳地。如《詩．陳風．墓門》：「墓門有棘，斧以斯之。」孔穎達疏：「塋域謂之墓。」《禮記．曲禮上》：「適墓不登壟，助葬必執紼。」鄭玄注：「墓，塋域。」

墓字的基本解释

墓
mù
埋葬死人的地方：墓穴。墓地。墓园。墓道。墓碑。坟墓。墓志铭。

墓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mù］
［《廣韻》莫故切，去暮，明。］
(1)坟墓。古代埋葬死者，封土隆起的叫坟，平的叫墓。
(2)指茔域，坟地。
(3)葬。

墓字的英文翻译

◎ 墓
grave, mausoleum, sepulture, the narrow bed, the narrow cell, tomb

墓字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　墓； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页238第12
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?莫故切，音暮。【說文】丘也。【鄭玄曰】冢塋之地，孝子所思慕之處。【禮·檀弓】古不修墓。又易墓非古也。【王制】墓地不請。【周禮·春官】墓大夫掌凡邦墓之地域，爲之圖，令國民族葬。凡爭墓地，聽其獄訟，帥其屬而巡墓厲。【註】墓厲，謂塋限遮列之處。庶人不封不樹，故不言冢而云墓。　又【揚子·方言】凡葬，無墳謂之墓，有墳謂之塋。故檀弓云：墓而不墳。又平曰墓、封曰冢、高曰墳。　又北谷曰墓。【史記·封禪書】西方神明之墓。　又【集韻】䝉晡切，音模。【前漢·班固敘傳】陵不崇墓。【註】墓音模。

墓字的源字形

墓字的起名意思

埋葬死人的地方。

tomb
Basic explanation of words
tomb
mù
Place where the dead are buried: the tomb. cemetery. Cemetery. Tomb. tombstone. grave. epitaph.
tomb
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mù］
["Guangyun" Do not cut, go to dusk, Ming. ]
(1) Tomb. In ancient times, burial of the dead was called a tomb if the soil was uplifted, and a tomb if it was flat.
(2) Refers to the tomb domain, the graveyard.
(3) Burial.
tomb
English translation of words
◎ Tomb
grave, mausoleum, sepulture, the narrow bed, the narrow cell, tomb
tomb
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Ugly Collection] [The Ministry of Soil Characters] 　 Tomb; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: page 238 to 12
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Do not cut, sound twilight. [Said Wen] Qiu Ye. [Zheng Xuan said] The place of the tomb, the place that the filial son longs for. [Li·Tan Gong] Ancient tombs were not repaired. The easy tomb is not ancient. [Royal System] The cemetery is not invited. [Zhou Li·Chunguan] The area where the doctor of the tomb holds the tomb of Fanbang is a picture for the burial of the nation. Everyone who fights for a cemetery, listens to his prison lawsuits, controls his subordinates, and patrols the graves fiercely. [Note] Tomb Li is the place where the tomb is restricted. The common people do not seal or tree, so they do not speak tombs but cloud tombs.　[Yangtze Dialect] Every burial is a tomb without a tomb, but a tomb is a tomb. Therefore, Tan Gongyun: Tomb not tomb. Ping said the tomb, sealing the tomb, and Gao said the tomb.　 Then Beigu said the tomb. [Historical Records · Feng Chan Book] Tomb of Western Gods.　[Jiyun] 晡晡切, sound mode. [Previous Han·Bangguxu Biography] The mausoleum is not a tomb. [Note] Tomb sound model.
tomb
Source glyph
tomb
Name meaning
The place where the dead are buried.
形声字。土表意,表示用土埋死人;莫(mo)表声,莫是暮的初文,其形像日落草丛,表示墓是人死后的归宿。古代死人
下葬后用土填坑,与地面齐平为墓,封土成丘为坟。
坟墓:~碑|公~|陵~。
~表 ~道~地 ~门 ~室~穴 ~葬 ~志
盗~ 坟~ 古~ 掘~ 扫~ 守~ 自掘坟~
墓
mù
对,
墓墓
楷
Пиктофонетические символы.
Значение слова «земля» означает, что мертвые погребены вместе с землей; «Мо» означает звук, а «Мо» - первый текст слова «Му», изображение которого похоже на закатную траву, что указывает на то, что гробница является домом людей после смерти.
После того, как в древние времена мертвых хоронили, для заполнения ямы использовали почву, которая находилась на одном уровне с землей в качестве могилы, и земля была закрыта, чтобы сформировать курган в качестве гробницы.
Могила: ~ Стела | Гонг ~ | Мавзолей ~.
~ Красота ~ Дао ~ Ди ~ Дверь ~ Комната ~ Acupoint ~ Похороны ~ Чжи
Pirate ~ Grave ~ Ancient ~ Dig ~ Sweep ~ Shou ~ Самокопание ~

могила; захоронение; гробница; мавзолей
上墓 посещать могилы
墓树 деревья (насаждения) на могиле
Radicals: 土, 莫  (dirt, greenhouse)
Meaning Mnemonic
There's a strange patch of dirt in this greenhouse that's actually a grave. Dig around a little and you'll find the marker buried in there. If you dig deeper you'll probably find less pleasant things.
I guess it makes sense to have a grave in a greenhouse. The heat will help the body decompose, then that nice, rich dirt will help the flowers grow.
Reading Mnemonic
You decide to dig even deeper into the grave out of curiosity and you find a bow (ぼ) and some arrows. This must be the grave of a great archer! But you probably shouldn't keep digging around in this grave looking for more stuff.
Hold the grave bow in your hands. It smells like dirt and wood. Maybe no one will notice if you take it... though you may end up haunted by whoever is buried in this grave.
